techmeme.title: Data breach notifications show US pharmaceutical giant Cencora has notified at least 1.43M individuals that their data was compromised in a February data breach (Zack Whittaker/TechCrunch)
Sources: Meta is offering Hollywood celebrities like Judi Dench millions of dollars for the right to use their voices for AI projects; SAG-AFTRA agreed to terms (Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg)
Intel shares fall 26% to close at $21.48 in their biggest drop since 1974, after the company reported a big earnings miss; Intel's market cap is now below $100B (CNBC)
Trump says Zuckerberg called him after the assassination attempt and told Trump he wouldn't endorse a Democrat because he "respected" Trump's reaction that day (Gaby Del Valle/The Verge)
Crypto lender Genesis and related companies complete their bankruptcy restructuring and begin distributing ~$4B in digital assets and cash to creditors (Olga Kharif/Bloomberg)
